title: FX graph for GBP v USD in disequilibrium

content.question: The United States and the United Kingdom are trading partners with flexible exchange rates. The currency of the United States is the dollar <math alttext="open parenthesis, dollar symbol, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>$</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>, and the currency of the United Kingdom is the pound <math alttext="open parenthesis, pound symbol, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>£</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. The graph provided shows the foreign exchange market for the pound. At an exchange rate of <math alttext="$2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>2</mn></math> per pound, which of the following will occur?

choices.label: There will be excess supply of the dollar.
There will be excess demand for the pound.

A <math alttext="2 pounds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>£</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> souvenir in Britain will cost <math alttext="$1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>1</mn></math> for United States tourists.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
